summary: This document discusses SEC violations related to insider trading and securities fraud involving Southern Financial Group, Inc. and its defendants, including Richard M. Wooten and Charles Dennis McKittrick. It notes the final judgments entered by Judge David C. Norton in December 2004.

persons.name: David C. Norton
persons.context: He is mentioned as the United States District Judge who entered final judgments against the defendants in the SEC case.

persons.name: Richard M. Wooten
persons.context: He is one of the defendants in the SEC violations case involving Southern Financial Group, Inc.

persons.name: Charles Dennis McKittrick
persons.context: He is also a defendant in the SEC violations case alongside Richard M. Wooten.

connections.description: Both are defendants in the SEC violations case involving Southern Financial Group, Inc.
David C. Norton is the judge who presided over the case involving Richard M. Wooten.
David C. Norton is the judge who presided over the case involving Charles Dennis McKittrick.

events.title: SEC Final Judgments
events.description: The SEC announced final judgments against Southern Financial Group, Inc., Richard M. Wooten, and Charles Dennis McKittrick for violations including insider trading and securities fraud.

keyFacts: The SEC announced final judgments against Southern Financial Group, Inc. and its defendants on December 22, 2004.
The violations included insider trading and securities fraud.
Judge David C. Norton presided over the case.
